description: French scarifier, from Late Latin scarificāre, from Latin scarifāre (“to scarify”), from Ancient Greek σκαριφᾶσθαι (skariphâsthai, “scratch”), from σκάριφος (skáriphos, “writing, drawing, sketching”)

verbs.description: scarify (third-person singular simple present scarifies, present participle scarifying, simple past and past participle scarified)

entries.meaning: (horticulture) To remove thatch (build-up of organic matter on the soil) from a lawn, to dethatch.

definitionGroups.group: To make scratches or cuts on.

entries.meaning: (horticulture) To damage the testa (seed coat) of a seed by cutting, scraping, chemicals, hot water, or fire to allow permeation of water and faster germination.
To break up, loosen, or roughen the surface of a field or road or a hard surface.
To scratch, etch, burn, or cut designs into one's skin as a form of body modification.
(obsolete or nonstandard) Denude, or lay waste to.
